questions.text: What are the two main types of services provided by the FCS program?
options: Mental health and substance abuse services
Supportive Housing and Supported Employment services
questions.explanation: The FCS program provides Supportive Housing services and Supported Employment services to help eligible individuals maintain stable housing and employment.

questions.text: What is the minimum age requirement for Supportive Housing services?
questions.explanation: Individuals must be 16 years or older to be eligible for Supportive Housing services.

questions.text: What billing code is used for Supportive Housing services per diem?
questions.explanation: Code H0043 is used for billing Supportive Housing services, per diem.

questions.text: What is the recommended minimum duration for each per diem code?
questions.explanation: Each per diem code should reflect at least 60 minutes of services, including at least one instance of face-to-face interaction with the enrollee.

questions.text: What is the PRISM score threshold for eligibility as a risk factor?
questions.explanation: Having a Predictive Risk Intelligence System (PRISM) score of 1.5 or above qualifies as a risk factor for eligibility.

questions.text: How many ADLs must an individual need assistance with to meet health needs-based criteria?
questions.explanation: Need for assistance with three or more activities of daily living (ADL) meets the health needs-based criteria.

questions.text: Critical incidents must be reported to Wellpoint within what timeframe?
options: Same business day of occurrence or provider awareness
questions.explanation: Critical incidents must be reported to Wellpoint on the same business day of occurrence or provider awareness.

questions.text: What is the electronic claims payer ID for Availity?
questions.explanation: The electronic claims payer ID for clearinghouse via Availity is WLPNT.

questions.text: How often is 'frequent' defined for institutional care stays in risk factor criteria?
options: One or more contacts in the past 12 months
Two or more contacts in the past 12 months
Three or more contacts in the past 12 months
Four or more contacts in the past 12 months
questions.explanation: Frequent is defined as two or more contacts in the past 12 months for institutional care stays.

questions.text: What is the definition of 'lengthy' for institutional care facility stays?
questions.explanation: Lengthy is defined as 90 or more consecutive days within an institutional care facility.

questions.text: What principle ensures tenants cannot be evicted from housing for rejecting FCS services?
questions.explanation: The tenant choice principle ensures that tenants cannot be evicted from their housing for rejecting services, disenrolling from FCS services, or changing FCS service provider.

questions.text: Where should paper claims be mailed?
questions.explanation: Paper claims should be mailed to: Washington Claims, Wellpoint, P.O. Box 61010, Virginia Beach, VA 23466-1010.

questions.text: What type of NPI is required for contracting?
questions.explanation: Nonparticipating providers needing to contract must provide a type 2 organization NPI.

questions.text: What is required for all address change requests?
questions.explanation: Phone numbers are required for all address change requests, even if unchanged, to ensure accuracy.

questions.text: What must be included with face-to-face interaction for per diem billing?
options: At least one instance of face-to-face interaction
questions.explanation: Each per diem code requires at least one instance of face-to-face interaction with the enrollee.

questions.text: How long can individuals who previously met HUD chronic homelessness definition be housed and still qualify?
questions.explanation: Individuals who previously met the HUD definition of chronic homelessness but have been housed in the last 60 days still qualify. Time housed may not exceed 60 days.

questions.text: What email address should be used for credentialing requests?
questions.explanation: All credentialing requests should be sent to FCSTPA@Wellpoint.com.

questions.text: What is the FCS Provider Services phone number?
questions.explanation: The FCS Provider Services phone number is 844-451-2828.

questions.text: What hours is the FCS team available?
questions.explanation: The FCS team is available Monday-Friday from 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Pacific time.

questions.text: What type of signature is NOT accepted for TIN change letters?
questions.explanation: The letter must have a physical signature; stamped signatures are not accepted.

questions.text: What does CSS stand for in the context of Supportive Housing?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Community Support Services, which support individuals with their ability to prepare for and transition to housing.

questions.text: What principle ensures a functional separation between housing and service roles?
questions.explanation: The delineated roles principle ensures a functional separation, with housing elements carried out by different staff than those providing services.

questions.text: What is included in collateral services?
options: External care coordination and housing search
questions.explanation: Collateral services include work such as external care coordination, housing search, and landlord engagement on behalf of a specific individual.

questions.text: What must providers have to be eligible for contracting?
options: W-9, NPI number (type 2), Provider Medicaid ID, and contact information
questions.explanation: Nonparticipating providers must submit W-9, NPI number (type 2 organization NPI), Provider Medicaid ID, and primary contact information.

questions.text: What online platform is used for electronic claims submission?
questions.explanation: Claims should be submitted online at Availity.com.

questions.text: What assessment is required to identify enrollee preferences related to housing?
questions.explanation: A functional needs assessment is conducted to identify the enrollee's preferences related to housing and needs for support.

questions.text: What is the Availity Client Services phone number?
questions.explanation: Availity Client Services can be reached at 800-AVAILITY (800-282-4548).

questions.text: What type of housing must Supportive Housing services promote?
questions.explanation: Supportive Housing must promote independent, permanent housing where tenants have full rights of tenancy.

questions.text: What is the address for mailing claim payment disputes?
questions.explanation: Claim payment disputes should be mailed to: Payment Dispute Unit, Wellpoint, P.O. Box 61599, Virginia Beach, VA 23466-1599.

questions.text: What must be included when submitting a claim payment dispute?
options: Name, address, phone, email, NPI/TIN, enrollee info, claim details, and supporting documentation
questions.explanation: Claim payment disputes require comprehensive information including provider details, enrollee information, disputed claims, and supporting documentation.

questions.text: What is the IVR system availability?
options: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
questions.explanation: The interactive voice response (IVR) system is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

questions.text: How many different in-home caregiver providers within 12 months qualifies as frequent turnover?
questions.explanation: History of frequent turnover is defined as utilizing three or more different in-home caregiver providers within the last 12 months.

questions.text: What right do Supportive Housing tenants have regarding challenging eviction?
options: Right to challenge eviction in landlord-tenant court
questions.explanation: Supportive Housing tenant leases confer full rights of tenancy, including the right to challenge eviction in landlord-tenant court.

questions.text: What is required for enrollee eligibility verification online?
questions.explanation: Enrollee eligibility can be verified online at waproviderone.org.

questions.text: What must Supportive Housing meet regarding tenant affordability?
questions.explanation: Supportive Housing must meet tenants' affordability standards.

questions.text: What is the fax number for the FCS program?
questions.explanation: The FCS program fax number is 844-470-8859.

questions.text: What type of settings must Supportive Housing tenants with disabilities receive services in?
questions.explanation: Supportive Housing tenants with disabilities have a right to receive housing and supportive services in the most integrated settings available.

questions.text: What services can be provided flexibly, including in-person or on behalf of an individual?
questions.explanation: Supportive Housing services can be provided flexibly, including in-person or on behalf of an individual.

questions.text: What is the purpose of coordination between housing and services staff?
options: To help prevent evictions and ensure tenant support access
questions.explanation: Property managers and support service staff coordinate to help prevent evictions and ensure tenants facing eviction have access to necessary services and supports.

questions.text: What website provides the most up-to-date FCS provider manual?
questions.explanation: The most updated version of the provider manual is available at provider.wellpoint.com/washington-provider/patient-care/foundational-community-supports.
